body_html:
Jenkins seems to be working, but I think the code is broken for non-Windows platforms:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blame/dbb9040ca31e25d81482559130e68ca928b19a6c/tensorflow/core/platform/env.cc#L35

This line seems to be including Windows-specific FS code unconditionally into cross-platform code. You probably need to wrap that #include in an #if defined(PLATFORM_WINDOWS)/#endif pair.
body_text:
Jenkins seems to be working, but I think the code is broken for non-Windows platforms:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blame/dbb9040ca31e25d81482559130e68ca928b19a6c/tensorflow/core/platform/env.cc#L35
This line seems to be including Windows-specific FS code unconditionally into cross-platform code. You probably need to wrap that #include in an #if defined(PLATFORM_WINDOWS)/#endif pair.
body:
Jenkins seems to be working, but I think the code is broken for non-Windows platforms:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blame/dbb9040ca31e25d81482559130e68ca928b19a6c/tensorflow/core/platform/env.cc#L35

This line seems to be including Windows-specific FS code unconditionally into cross-platform code. You probably need to wrap that `#include` in an `#if defined(PLATFORM_WINDOWS)`/`#endif` pair.
